definition:
A sequence or arbitrary ordered set or one-dimensional array of numbers,
$a$, is said to be in [*ascending order*]{} if each $a_i \le a_{i + 1}$.
For example, the Fibonacci sequence is in ascending order: 1, 1, 2, 3,
5, 8, 13, 21 ... The Perrin sequence is not in ascending order: 3, 0, 2,
3, 2, 5, 5, 7, 10, 12, 17 ...

In a trivial sense, the sequence of values of the sign function is in
ascending order: ... -1, -1, -1, 0, 1, 1, 1... When each
$a_i < a_{i + 1}$ in the sequence, set or array, then it can be said to
be in [*strictly ascending order*]{}.
